name: Spanish and Hispanic Studies
descriptions: The Spanish and Hispanic Studies minor is available in three tracks: Spanish and Hispanic Studies, Spanish for Health Professions, and Spanish for Business Professions. All tracks require 21 credits at the 20103 level or above.
No courses taught in English qualify for any track. Grades below C- and Pass/No-Credit courses do not count. This minor is not available to Spanish and Hispanic Studies majors.

courses: Track A (Spanish): 21 hours of Spanish courses at 20103 level or above, including upper-level electives
Track B (Health): Requires SPAN 31503 and SPAN 42503 plus additional Spanish courses
Track C (Business): Requires SPAN 31603 and SPAN 42603 plus additional Spanish courses

electiveCourses.description: Any course taught in Spanish at the 30000 or 40000 level may be taken as an elective. Portuguese for Spanish Speakers (PORT 20503) may fulfill one elective in any track.
